transcript.content: Eminem - Sing For the Moment

Well, here we are again. Xfm on a Saturday, just gone one o'clock Steve, if I'm very much mistaken, but we're not here, as such, we're away again, gallivanting around, erm, we've gotta do a special sort of 'Best of' again.
Okay.
Which we did a few weeks ago, so this is the best of the last three weeks...
Steve laughs
Which I think is, I mean I think it's the best three weeks we've ever had. But I'd like it condensed into two hours.
Yeah, some great music as well in there?
Yeah, there'll be some great music, interspersed with fine chat, that you've already heard.
Yeah.
Except this bit, this bit's new. We've actually, out of the kindness of our heart, we've come in, erm, we've come in last week.
Yep... yep.
...and we've done a few clips. Just cos we felt a bit guilty about shooting off and leaving...
I mean even now, having heard this link, I'm beginning to wonder if it was worth our time.
Oh dear.
When I Was About Seven I Enjoyed It
Athlete - You've Got the Style
Kings of Leon - Molly's Chambers
Xfm 104.9, we're not here. Erm this next clip is one of my favourite clips, look, it needs no introduction, here it is.
You've Given Him An Inch And He's Taken A Yard
The Cardigans - For What It's Worth

Xfm 104.9, Ricky Gervais show with Steve Merchant, hello there, and we're not here this week, we're off jetting around the world, so we've pre-recorded these links, the time is currently somewhere between 1 and 3 o'clock.
So, a timecheck there from Steve Merchant.
No problem.
Yeah and oh, what- what about this weather, isn't it warm – stroke – edit that Karl – cold, okay, whichever one.
I'm pleased to see that the congestion charge has had some considerable effect/had no effect.
Yeah so just you know, erm, oh wasn't that great on the telly last night, the film...
I particularly enjoyed last night's Eastenders/Coronation Street/Brookside.
Okay...
They giggle.
Guns 'n' Roses - Sweet Child O'Mine
OK, Stop Eating Karl, You've Ate All The Food, That's The Plate
Ho, ho, ho, that was great. That was very, very funny indeed.
What a wonderful clip that was.
I enjoyed it.
Do you remember that?
I...yeah...
Yeah, well...few weeks ago weren't it really, I mean...
I think it was last week.
We'd have to have very, very bad memories, not to remember that hilarious clip, I'd like to hear that again maybe in a couple weeks time when I'm away.
Yes, absolutely.
This is embarrassing isn't it. I mean, you know... but then you know the good thing is, on telly I feel a bit guilty about putting out shoddy rubbish cos I'm getting paid an awful lot.
Yes.
But, here, you know, I don't, I don't give a sh*t. They can bleep that.
They will do, they will do.
White Stripes - Dead Leaves And The Dirty Ground
David Bowie – Lady Stardust
The Doctor Said I Was Gonna Die
Doves - Caught By The River
Coldplay - Clocks
That is a blinding record and before that Rick, what did you make of those adverts, they were great weren't they...
I like them, yeah, I'm gonna buy all them products on the way home.
...and that's endorsed by Ricky Gervais. He's won awards. Rick, d'you remember this, this was a hilarious moment.
No.
No you'll remember this, when you hear it.
Go on.
It was when Karl said something that was basically, well, I think for a lot of people, it sounded like a lot of old bollocks.
Ricky laughs.
Mad World Though, Innit!
The Cure - I Will Always Love You
Missy Elliot - Gossip Folks (Fat Boy Slim Radio Edit)
If you've just tuned in, it's Xfm 104.9, you've got that bit right, it's the Ricky Gervais Show, with me Stephen Merchant.
Hello there.

Karl is actually in a little booth, we're not in the studio you see, this is pre-recorded, we recorded this last week, cos we're away, and this is sort of like the 'best of', best of the last three weeks, since last time we were away when we put out the 'best of'...
The Old Man And The Twix
Radiohead - Just
Eels - Going over to Susan's House
Xfm 104.9, we're not here.
It is a bit like being Dennis Norden. Playing some great, great, err, great moments from the show.
I just imagine Dennis Norden one day, sort of, just waking up out of his stupor, and doing, and he'll go into the producer, and go “I've just seen a couple of my programmes...”
“I just saw It'll be Alright on the Night 18.”
“It's sh*t.”
'It is terrible.'

“Why didn't someone tell me?” 'Well we didn't wanna upset you cos, because, er, you know...' “but I've been doing it way too long! Where you just gonna let me go on forever?” 'Well, until you died, yeah.' “Well, why can't my son take over?” 'Well, he's 80 Dennis.'
“And the jokes I'm doing they're awful.”
“They're just... why have I got that clipboard?”
“I've written these jokes, they're not funny, there's an audience, they're laughing, what are they laughing at?”
'They're not laughing, they're... not laughing, that's canned laughter.'
“Who are those audiences? Who goes to an audience for 'It'll be Alright on the Night'?”
'A lot of 'em are older than you!'
“It can't be right.”
'You know we have 15% fatality in one of your audiences.'
“But I went home at Christmas, I watched one of the episodes, with my family and friends, I said 'watch this you'll love it', stony faced, no-one laughed, they all thought it was sh*t.”
'Well, it is sh*t.'
Well why didn't you tell me earlier.
We didn't wanna hurt your feelings, you're an old man. You may be upward of 102.
I didn't realise.
Yeah.
Chuckin' a Stone in the Air
This is Xfm 104.9, with me Stephen Merchant.
Hello.
You're listening to the best of, basically, Karl Pilkington.
Sound effect of a tape loading
Brains In A Bag Curry Microwave Head Story
Cat Stevens - Lilywhite
